BBox2

Defines a axis-aligned bounding box (in 2D)

Functions
BBox2
BBox2()

Default constructor

BBox2
BBox2(
Vector2 &topLeft,
Vector2 &bottomRight
)

Constructor

Parameters
topLeft
Vector2&

top left corner for bbox

bottomRight
Vector2&

bottom right corner for bbox

Empty
bool Empty()

Determines if bbox is empty

Returns

Returns true if bbox is empty. False otherwise.

AddPoint
void AddPoint(
float x,
float y
)

Adds the specified point to the bounding box. If the point is outside the bbox then the bbox's dimensions are expanded to include the point.

Parameters
x
float

x coordinate for point

y
float

y coordinate for point

AddPoint
void AddPoint(
Vector2 &pt
)

Adds the specified point to the bounding box. If the point is outside the bbox then the bbox's dimensions are expanded to include the point.

Parameters
pt
Vector2&

point to add

PointInside
bool PointInside(
const Vector2 &p
)

Determines if the specified point is inside the bounding box

Parameters
p
const Vector2&

point to test

Returns

Returns true if point is inside bbox. False otherwise.

PointInside
bool PointInside(
const Vector2 &p,
float tolerance
)

Determines if the specified point, given some tolerance, is inside the bounding box

Parameters
p
const Vector2&

point to test

tolerance
float

tolerance to use when testing point

Returns

Returns true if point is inside bbox. False otherwise.
